p: Two other molecules, T-cell immunoglobulin and mucin domain-1 (TIM-1), recently involved in ZIKV entry, and Glycosaminoglycans (GAGs), important for the efficient infection of alphaviruses (i.e., Eastern equine encephalitis virus (EEEV) and Venezuelan equine encephalitis virus (VEEV)), have been implicated in CHIKV attachment (reviewed in [ 83]) to human cells, while HSC70 and ATP synthase beta subunit have been suggested as CHIKV binding factors in mosquito cells [ 87, 88].
